CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1956, pg. 18, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Simon L. Franklin...honeymooning in New York." Accompanying article reads: "Miss Harris is Bride - Marlene Barbara Harris became the bride of Simon Lee Franklin, at a ceremony held at Ebenezer Baptist Church, with the Rev. James B. Cayce officiating.  The bride chose a white embroidered cotton satin informal gown and a veil attached to a seed pearl crown.  She carried a white Bible decked with an orchid.  Attending the bride's maid of honor was her sister, Joyce Harris, who wore an afternoon dress of blue sateen, carrying a bouquet of blue and white carnations.  Both dresses were designed by the bride.  John Trower was the groom's best man, and James Harris and MacDonald Terry served as ushers.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Harris and the groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Simon Franklin.  Among the out-of-town guests were the bride's mother, Mrs. Lucinda Lawrence; a cousin, Henderson E. Hinton; and the bride's sisters, Deon, Donna and Denise, of North Carolina.  After honeymooning in New York City, they will reside in Homewood."
TitMainTitle: Groom Simon Lee Franklin wearing dark suit and diagonally striped tie, and bride Marlene Barbara Harris Franklin wearing floral dress and elbow length gloves, posed in front of arch with ferns, in Ebenezer Baptist Church
